data.content: The library uses weak references for node reactivity in the following utils:

The bindObject/bindText/bindEffect utilities, when used extensively ( 500up instances ) within a repeat/invalidate loop outside of a component, can cause memory leaks.
When DOM nodes inside a repeat/invalidate are removed, it will take some time before the garbage collector removes the reference to the node and along with it the callbacks tied to reactivity.
In these cases, it is recommended to use components within repeat/invalidate modules. When a component is removed, the various modules inside it will be automatically disconnected as the component's state is lost.

For this reason, the use of ref and refs becomes not mandatory but recommended.
Weak primitives work well when they are the only references; creating additional references may impact the garbage collectorâ€™s ability to free memory.
